cvpiaHabitat
  • Reference

Battle Creek Instream Flow to Habitat Area Relationship

A dataset containing the Weighted Usable Area (WUA) in square feet per 1000 feet as a function of flow in cubic feet per second

battle_creek_instream

Format

dataframe with 35 rows and 6 variables:

flow_cfs

integer flow value in cubic feet per second

FR_spawn_wua

spawning WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

FR_fry_wua

fry (up to 50 mm) WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

FR_juv_wua

juvenile WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

adult_trout_WUA

adult trout WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

watershed

name of watershed

Source

Payne 1995

Details

The spawning and rearing WUA values were derived from a PHABSIM model. The results are for Fall Run Chinook.

Examples

battle_creek_instream
#> # A tibble: 35 x 6
#>    flow_cfs FR_spawn_wua FR_fry_wua FR_juv_wua adult_trout_wua    watershed
#>       <int>        <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>           <dbl>        <chr>
#>  1        8       130.33   15577.42    4951.72         9122.98 Battle Creek
#>  2       10       200.10   15410.91    5858.00         9728.00 Battle Creek
#>  3       12       275.77   15181.16    6704.73        10253.11 Battle Creek
#>  4       14       358.81   14928.81    7488.45        10711.28 Battle Creek
#>  5       16       435.23   14661.05    8211.50        11113.88 Battle Creek
#>  6       18       513.79   14371.35    8879.50        11459.39 Battle Creek
#>  7       20       597.66   14082.55    9490.31        11757.96 Battle Creek
#>  8       22       684.92   13801.10   10052.14        12016.61 Battle Creek
#>  9       24       770.04   13522.99   10572.89        12252.12 Battle Creek
#> 10       26       846.28   13115.41   11205.03        12438.86 Battle Creek
#> # ... with 25 more rows
